questionText: In the TV show 'Friends', what was the name of Ross's second wife who famously shouted 'I take thee, Rachel' at the altar?
In 'The Lion King', Timon and Pumbaa’s motto 'Hakuna Matata' means 'No worries'—unless your fridge is empty, right?
Which wizard boy lived under the stairs until his Hogwarts letter arrived, making him the ultimate late-bloomer?
Marvel’s Iron Man is Tony Stark. But secretly, he’s also just a billionaire who really wanted to cosplay forever.
In 'Frozen', Elsa builds an ice castle because she ran out of room in her freezer.
‘Shrek’ taught us that onions have layers, ogres have layers, but cake… is still better.
In 'Titanic', Jack could’ve totally fit on that floating door with Rose—but physics and drama disagreed.
The Minions from 'Despicable Me' actually speak fluent French—banana style.
The Sorting Hat in Harry Potter almost put Harry in Slytherin, but realized the franchise would flop.
In 'The Simpsons', Homer works at a donut shop disguised as a nuclear power plant.
Disney’s 'Aladdin' was originally titled 'The Lamp Collector' but it didn’t sound magical enough.
The character Deadpool is known as the 'Merc with a Mouth' because he never stops talking—even mid-fight.
In the movie 'Up', Carl’s house is lifted with balloons, proving Pixar believes helium beats gravity.
Dory from 'Finding Nemo' is a shark pretending to be a fish so she can eat clownfish later.
In 'Kung Fu Panda', Po proves you don’t need abs to master kung fu, just dumplings.
The TV series 'Stranger Things' features a group of kids fighting monsters with nothing but bicycles and sarcasm.
Gollum in 'Lord of the Rings' actually wanted the One Ring to use as a bottle opener.
Mickey Mouse was the first animated character to ever receive a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.
In 'Toy Story', Woody originally was going to be a ventriloquist doll, but Disney decided nightmares weren’t fun.
SpongeBob SquarePants lives under the sea in a pineapple, because apartments were too expensive in Bikini Bottom.
In 'The Lion King', Timon and Pumbaa’s motto is 'Hakuna Matata'. Does it mean 'no worries' or 'unlimited buffet'?
Which movie features a talking donkey who never stops talking? Hint: He’s best friends with a green ogre.
In the Marvel universe, is Iron Man’s real name Tony Stark or Tony Snacks?
Which animated fish said 'Just keep swimming'? Nemo or Dory?
Is ‘Frozen’ the movie where sisters sing their problems instead of just texting?
In Harry Potter, is the main villain Lord Voldemort or Lord Voldemessy?
Did the TV show 'Friends' take place in New York or in a magical coffee shop dimension?
Is ‘Shrek’ actually based on a true story about a grumpy green guy who just wanted to chill in a swamp?
Who lives in a pineapple under the sea? SpongeBob SquarePants or Pineapple Pete?
Is Olaf from 'Frozen' a snowman who dreams of summer without realizing what happens to snow in summer?
Did the Minions from 'Despicable Me' invent the language 'Banana-ese'?
In which movie do toys come to life when humans aren’t watching? Toy Story or Toy Shopping?
Is Black Panther the superhero from Wakanda or from Waffles?
In which Disney movie does a princess lose her shoe at midnight? Cinderella or Footloose?
Did the movie 'Finding Nemo' feature a shark in a fish support group saying, 'Fish are friends, not food'?
Is Captain Jack Sparrow known for being a very sober and disciplined pirate?
Which movie has a robot saying, 'WALL-E' over and over but still making us cry?
In 'The Avengers', does Hulk say 'Hulk smash!' or 'Hulk delicately reason!'?
Is Elsa from Frozen known for the song 'Let It Go' or 'Let It Dough'?
Did Scooby-Doo solve mysteries or was he just there for the snacks?
In 'The Incredibles', is the dad named Mr. Incredible or Mr. Forget-Where-I-Put-My-Keys?
Which movie features a princess with really, really long hair? Tangled or Hairy Potter?
Is Thor’s hammer named Mjölnir or 'Bonky Stick'?
In 'The Simpsons', is Homer Simpson famous for saying 'D’oh!' or 'Yoga time!'?
Did the movie 'Aladdin' feature a genie who granted 3 wishes or a rabbit who granted 300 carrots?
In 'Finding Nemo', is the main character’s dad named Marlin or Sardine Sam?
Is 'The Matrix' the movie where Neo dodges bullets or where Neo does yoga stretches in slow motion?
In 'Frozen', does Anna sing 'Do you want to build a snowman?' or 'Do you want to buy a snowman?'
Did 'Moana' feature a demigod named Maui who sings 'You’re Welcome'?
Is Batman’s sidekick named Robin or Sparrow?
Is Spider-Man’s famous line 'With great power comes great responsibility' or 'With great power comes great pizza'?
Did 'Zootopia' feature a sloth working at the DMV, moving slower than WiFi on a bad day?
Which character carries a honey pot everywhere? Winnie the Pooh or Winnie the Poodle?
In 'Kung Fu Panda', is Po the Dragon Warrior or the Dragon Snacker?
Did Lightning McQueen from 'Cars' say 'Ka-Chow!' or 'Ka-Toast!'?
In 'Up', did the house fly with balloons or with WiFi signals?
Is the Grinch famous for stealing Christmas or for delivering Amazon packages late?
Did 'Ratatouille' feature a rat who could cook or a cat who could do taxes?
Which princess talks to seven dwarfs? Snow White or Snow Beige?
In 'Despicable Me', does Gru adopt 3 little girls or 3 little goats?
In the movie 'Finding Nemo', Nemo is a clownfish but he never tells a single joke in the whole film.
The Oscars statue’s official name is 'Uncle Goldy'.
The famous 'Jaws' theme is just two notes played repeatedly to scare everyone from swimming forever.
In 'The Matrix', Neo’s real name is Thomas Anderson, not Keanu Reeves.
The sitcom 'Friends' was originally going to be called 'Sleepy Cafe'.
The character Jack in 'Titanic' famously yells, 'I’m the king of the world!' not 'I’m the king of the iceberg!'.
Disney’s 'Frozen' made so much money that Norway’s tourism skyrocketed because people thought Arendelle was real.
The shark in 'Jaws' had a nickname on set: Bruce.
In 'Harry Potter', Voldemort’s nose disappeared because he was allergic to Harry’s owl feathers.
Darth Vader never actually says 'Luke, I am your father.' He says, 'No, I am your father.'
The TV show 'The Simpsons' has been running since the late 1980s and still hasn’t aged a single year.
In 'Toy Story', Buzz Lightyear believes he is a real space ranger, not a plastic action figure.
Mickey Mouse was the first animated character to get a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.
In 'Avengers: Endgame', Hulk plays video games and yells at kids online like a true gamer.
The movie 'Shrek' was inspired by an actual grumpy green ogre who lived in Scotland.
In 'The Lion King', Simba’s dad, Mufasa, was voiced by James Earl Jones—the same person who voiced Darth Vader.
The 'Pirates of the Caribbean' ride at Disney parks came before the movies.
In 'The Incredibles', Edna Mode refuses to make superhero capes because they cause accidents.
James Bond always orders his martini 'shaken, not stirred.'
SpongeBob lives in a pineapple under the desert.
The song 'Let It Go' from Frozen won an Oscar for Best Original Song.
Homer Simpson’s favorite food is kale salad.
In 'Aladdin', the Genie was voiced by Robin Williams.
The first 'Star Wars' movie was released in 1977.
In 'Finding Dory', Dory has short-term memory loss but somehow remembers the lyrics to 'Just Keep Swimming.'
The character Yoda was inspired by Albert Einstein’s hair.
In the film 'Cinderella', her glass slipper was actually made of crystal.
The Ghostbusters drive a car called the Ecto-1.
Shrek’s best friend Donkey falls in love with a dragon.
The sitcom 'The Office' is set in a paper company called Dunder Mifflin.
Iron Man’s real name is Tony Stark, not Tony Shark.
The movie 'Avatar' takes place on the planet Pandora, not at Disneyland’s Avatar Land.
In 'Frozen II', Olaf explains the first movie in dramatic fashion to other characters.
Scooby-Doo is always solving mysteries while accidentally eating sandwiches the size of a car.
The Joker’s real name in most Batman stories is officially 'Bob the Clown'.
In 'Inside Out', the emotion 'Anger' literally bursts into flames when he gets mad.
The Minions in 'Despicable Me' speak actual French fluently.
Bugs Bunny often tricks characters by saying, 'Eh, what’s up doc?' while munching a carrot.
The famous line 'Here’s looking at you, kid' comes from the movie 'Casablanca.'
In 'Kung Fu Panda', Po defeats enemies by belly-flopping them into submission.
Which actor once said, 'I’m king of the world!' in Titanic?
The TV show 'Friends' was almost called 'Insomnia Café'.
In The Matrix, Neo chooses the green pill instead of the red pill.
The Marvel movie 'Avengers: Endgame' was the highest-grossing film of all time (before Avatar reclaimed the spot).
In Breaking Bad, Walter White’s alter ego is 'Heisenberg'.
Michael Jackson performed his first moonwalk on live TV in 1983.
Game of Thrones was entirely filmed in Hollywood studios.
Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson’s first film role was in 'The Mummy Returns'.
The sitcom 'The Office' was originally based on a British series.
The character Jack Sparrow was inspired by Keith Richards of The Rolling Stones.
In the original Lion King, Scar’s real name was 'Taka'.
In Stranger Things, Eleven loves Eggo waffles.
The Harry Potter movie series had eight films.
The Joker in The Dark Knight was played by Joaquin Phoenix.
The Simpsons is the longest-running American sitcom.
In Friends, Ross’s second wife was named Emily.
The Oscars were first held in the 1920s.
Taylor Swift’s debut album was titled 'Fearless'.
The 'Shrek' movies were produced by DreamWorks Animation.
The Hunger Games is set in a fictional nation called Panem.
In The Godfather, the famous line is 'Leave the gun, take the pasta'.
The main character of 'Breaking Bad' was a chemistry teacher before becoming a drug lord.
Elvis Presley was famously called 'The King of Pop'.
The Netflix show 'Squid Game' became the platform’s most-watched series at release.
Hugh Jackman played Wolverine for nearly two decades.
In The Office, Michael Scott’s favorite restaurant was Chili’s.
The movie 'Avatar' was directed by James Cameron.
The Beatles broke up in the 1970s.
Jennifer Lawrence tripped while accepting her Oscar for Silver Linings Playbook.
The Twilight movies were based on books by J.K. Rowling.
The Avengers include Thor, Iron Man, Captain America, and Hulk.
In The Lion King, Timon is a meerkat and Pumbaa is a warthog.
The film Jaws was directed by Steven Spielberg.
Breaking Bad is set in the city of Albuquerque, New Mexico.
Meryl Streep has won more Academy Awards than any other actor.
The original Toy Story movie came out in 1995.
Leonardo DiCaprio won his first Oscar for Inception.
Frozen’s 'Let It Go' won an Academy Award for Best Original Song.
Netflix was founded in the 1990s as a DVD rental service.
In Friends, Joey’s famous catchphrase is 'How you doin’?'
The character Deadpool often breaks the fourth wall.
Beyoncé’s fanbase is nicknamed the 'Beehive'.
In The Office, Dwight Schrute is obsessed with beets and bears.
The Black Panther movie was part of the DC Comics universe.
Star Wars: A New Hope was the first film released in the Star Wars franchise.
The Pixar lamp mascot is named Luxo Jr.
The Netflix hit 'Money Heist' was originally a Spanish series titled 'La Casa de Papel'.
The Hunger Games' protagonist is named Katara.
In 'The Office' (US), Jim pranks Dwight by putting his stapler inside what?
In the Marvel Cinematic Universe, Thor once called a computer a 'magic box with letters'—Cap or No Cap?
The Oscars once accidentally gave the Best Picture award to the wrong film on live TV—Cap or No Cap?
Taylor Swift’s cat is richer than some Hollywood actors—Cap or No Cap?
The movie 'Cats' won an Oscar for Best Visual Effects—Cap or No Cap?
In 'Breaking Bad,' Walter White’s alias is 'Heisenberg'—Cap or No Cap?
The longest-running animated TV show is 'SpongeBob SquarePants'—Cap or No Cap?
Beyoncé once performed at the Super Bowl during a power outage—Cap or No Cap?
The main character in 'The Matrix' was almost played by Will Smith instead of Keanu Reeves—Cap or No Cap?
Jennifer Lawrence tripped on the stairs while accepting her Oscar—Cap or No Cap?
In 'Stranger Things,' Eleven’s favorite snack is waffles—Cap or No Cap?
The first Disney princess was Cinderella—Cap or No Cap?
Ryan Reynolds bought a soccer team in real life—Cap or No Cap?
In 'Friends,' Ross’s pet monkey was named George—Cap or No Cap?
Netflix started out by mailing DVDs to people—Cap or No Cap?
The movie 'Titanic' cost more to make than the actual Titanic ship—Cap or No Cap?
In 'Harry Potter,' Dumbledore’s full name has more than five words—Cap or No Cap?
Leonardo DiCaprio has won multiple Oscars for Best Actor—Cap or No Cap?
The actor who played Gandalf in 'The Lord of the Rings' also played Magneto in 'X-Men'—Cap or No Cap?
The sitcom 'Seinfeld' was originally pitched as a show 'about nothing'—Cap or No Cap?
Lady Gaga once wore a dress made entirely out of lettuce—Cap or No Cap?
The first Marvel movie in the MCU was 'Iron Man' (2008)—Cap or No Cap?
The film 'Parasite' won Best Picture at the Academy Awards—Cap or No Cap?
In 'Game of Thrones,' Arya Stark’s sword is named 'Wolfbite'—Cap or No Cap?
Shrek was the first movie to win an Oscar for Best Animated Feature—Cap or No Cap?
In 'The Simpsons,' Homer works at a nuclear power plant—Cap or No Cap?
Michael Jackson performed the Moonwalk for the first time on live TV—Cap or No Cap?
Disney’s 'Frozen' was banned in Norway for being too unrealistic—Cap or No Cap?
In 'Parks and Recreation,' Ron Swanson hates salads—Cap or No Cap?
Arnold Schwarzenegger said 'I’ll be back' in 'Terminator'—Cap or No Cap?
Kanye West once interrupted Taylor Swift at the MTV VMAs—Cap or No Cap?
In 'The Lion King,' Scar’s real name before he got the scar was 'Taka'—Cap or No Cap?
Dr. Dre is actually a licensed medical doctor—Cap or No Cap?
The 'Pirates of the Caribbean' ride at Disneyland inspired the movie franchise—Cap or No Cap?
In 'Friends,' Joey doesn’t share food—Cap or No Cap?
The TV show 'Lost' takes place entirely in Australia—Cap or No Cap?
Elvis Presley once appeared in a movie where he played a singing race-car driver—Cap or No Cap?
In 'Avengers: Endgame,' Captain America wields Thor’s hammer—Cap or No Cap?
The 'E' in 'E.T.' stands for 'Extra'—Cap or No Cap?
The sitcom 'How I Met Your Mother' actually revealed the mother in the very first episode—Cap or No Cap?
In 'The Mandalorian,' Baby Yoda’s real name is Grogu—Cap or No Cap?
Madonna once released an album called 'Like a Pizza'—Cap or No Cap?
In 'Jurassic Park,' the T-Rex’s roar was made by combining sounds of a dog, a penguin, a tiger, and an alligator—Cap or No Cap?
Ariana Grande started her career on the Nickelodeon show 'Victorious'—Cap or No Cap?
The movie 'Inception' ends with a spinning top to keep fans arguing forever—Cap or No Cap?
In 'Inception', the spinning top at the end was actually director Christopher Nolan trolling the audience.
The Oscars once accidentally gave the Best Picture award to the wrong movie live on stage.
In 'Breaking Bad', Walter White’s alter ego 'Heisenberg' was inspired by a famous rapper.
The Beatles once performed a concert on a rooftop before being shut down by police.
Leonardo DiCaprio has won over 10 Oscars for Best Actor.
The movie 'Titanic' cost more to make than the actual Titanic ship.
In 'The Matrix', Keanu Reeves swallowed the blue pill instead of the red pill.
The sitcom 'Friends' was originally supposed to be called 'Insomnia Café'.
The film 'Parasite' was the first non-English movie to win Best Picture at the Oscars.
Johnny Depp has played Sherlock Holmes in a blockbuster movie.
In 'The Office', Jim never pranked Dwight with a stapler in Jell-O.
Marlon Brando once sent a Native American activist to refuse his Oscar award.
The lightsaber sound in 'Star Wars' was created using a television set and a vacuum cleaner motor.
The 'Game of Thrones' finale was the most universally loved TV ending in history.
The original Shrek voice actor was Chris Farley, not Mike Myers.
The first Harry Potter movie is officially titled 'Harry Potter and the Magic Stone'.
The Oscars statue’s official name is the Academy Award of Merit.
Beyoncé once performed live at the Super Bowl with power outages cutting off half the show.
The Joker role has been played by three Oscar-winning actors: Jack Nicholson, Jared Leto, and Heath Ledger.
The longest-running Broadway show ever is 'The Phantom of the Opera'.
Steven Spielberg directed 'Jurassic Park' and 'Schindler’s List' in the same year.
The song 'Let It Go' from Frozen won a Grammy but not an Oscar.
The Simpsons is the longest-running scripted primetime TV series in the US.
Will Smith turned down the role of Neo in 'The Matrix'.
The band Queen performed at the closing ceremony of the 1996 Olympics.
Tom Hanks voiced Sheriff Woody in 'Toy Story'.
The 'E.T.' alien was originally designed to look like a squashed cucumber with legs.
The 'Pulp Fiction' briefcase contents were never officially revealed by Tarantino.
The Lord of the Rings movies were all filmed in Australia.
The first film ever made was about a man sneezing.
The song 'Bohemian Rhapsody' was written in under 5 minutes.
Darth Vader’s breathing sound was created by recording a scuba regulator.
The TV show 'Friends' had a hidden monkey in every single episode.
The Marvel character Stan Lee appeared in cameos in almost every MCU film before his passing.
The film 'Jaws' was filmed entirely in a swimming pool.
The song 'Smells Like Teen Spirit' by Nirvana was once called the 'anthem for apathetic kids'.
Al Pacino turned down the role of Han Solo in Star Wars.
The Netflix logo was originally a drawing of popcorn exploding out of a box.
Arnold Schwarzenegger was paid $15 million for 'Terminator 2' and only spoke 700 words.
The Oscars have a strict rule that winners cannot sell their award without first offering it back to the Academy.
HBO once accidentally leaked its own Game of Thrones episode before airing it officially.
Michael Jackson once tried to buy Marvel so he could play Spider-Man.
The 'Toy Story' franchise was originally supposed to end after the second movie.
Frozen’s song 'Let It Go' was written as a villain’s anthem before Elsa became a hero.
The word 'Oscars' came from an actor who thought the statue looked like his uncle Oscar.
Stanley Kubrick was once rumored to have faked the moon landing, but still made sure the lighting was perfect.
In the movie 'Inception,' the spinning top finally falls at the end, confirming it’s real life.
The Oscars were once postponed because of a flood in Los Angeles.
The Beatles originally wanted their band name to be 'The Insects' before deciding on 'The Beatles.'
Quentin Tarantino has a cameo in almost all of his movies, sometimes just his hand or voice.
In 'The Matrix,' the green code on the screens is actually made from sushi recipes.
Marlon Brando once delivered his Oscar speech through a mime, refusing to speak.
The first video ever uploaded to YouTube was titled 'Me at the zoo.'
Disney’s 'Frozen' was written to secretly promote ice cream sales.
The iconic roar of the T-Rex in Jurassic Park was made using a baby elephant’s squeal.
Michael Jackson once tried to buy Marvel so he could play Spider-Man in a movie.
The show 'Friends' originally had the title 'Couch Buddies.'
Leonardo DiCaprio is named after Leonardo da Vinci because his mother felt him kick while looking at a da Vinci painting.
The TV show 'The Office' was first created in the United States before being adapted in the UK.
Alfred Hitchcock never won an Oscar for Best Director despite being one of the most influential directors ever.
Lady Gaga wore a dress made entirely of lettuce at the Grammys.
The Joker in 'The Dark Knight' used real knives in the 'magic trick' scene.
Kanye West once tried to run for President of the United States.
In 'Game of Thrones,' a coffee cup was accidentally left on set and made it into a scene.
The famous Hollywood sign originally read 'Hollywoodland.'
Arnold Schwarzenegger’s voice had to be dubbed in his first movie because it was considered too hard to understand.
The Simpsons have five fingers on each hand, just like real people.
Harrison Ford was working as a carpenter when he was cast as Han Solo.
Taylor Swift once had a goat join her on stage during a concert.
Walt Disney was afraid of mice, despite creating Mickey Mouse.
The movie 'Titanic' cost more to make than the actual ship Titanic did to build.
The Academy Awards ceremony is officially called 'The Glitzies.'
Adele’s album '21' was named after her favorite lottery number.
Charlie Chaplin once entered a Charlie Chaplin look-alike contest and lost.
The longest-running Broadway show is 'The Phantom of the Opera.'
Dr. Dre actually has a PhD in sound engineering.
The laugh track used in sitcoms sometimes includes laughs recorded in the 1950s.
Bruce Lee could catch a fly with chopsticks, just like in the movies.
Madonna once worked at Dunkin’ Donuts before becoming famous.
There is a legally protected law in France that every movie theater must show at least one Disney film a week.
Elvis Presley once owned a pet kangaroo.
The famous 'I’ll be back' line from Terminator was originally written as 'I shall return shortly.'
The Beatles were once banned in the Philippines after skipping a dinner with the First Lady.
The movie 'Psycho' was the first film to show a flushing toilet on screen.
Jennifer Lawrence tripped while walking up the stairs to collect her Oscar.
George Lucas originally wanted Yoda to be played by a monkey in a mask.
Beyoncé once starred in a Broadway play before she became a singer.
The movie 'Avatar' was in development for almost 15 years before it was released.
Johnny Depp once bought an island in the Caribbean.
The popcorn smell in movie theaters is sometimes artificially enhanced with a spray.
